courseDescription: Dive into Java programming from basics to advanced concepts including OOP, collections, and concurrency.

topics.topicContent: To start Java development, you need to install the Java Development Kit (JDK). Download it from Oracle or use OpenJDK.
Java supports various data types like int, float, char, boolean, and reference types like arrays and objects.
Java provides control statements like if-else, switch, for loop, while loop, and do-while loop for decision making and looping.
In Java, a class is a blueprint for creating objects. An object is an instance of a class. A class can have attributes and methods.
An array is a collection of elements of the same type. It is a fixed-sized data structure that stores a group of elements of the same type.
A list is a collection of elements that can be dynamically resized. It is an ordered collection of elements that allows duplicate elements.
A map is a collection of key-value pairs. It is an unordered collection of elements that allows duplicate keys.
A set is a collection of unique elements. It is an unordered collection of elements that does not allow duplicate elements.
The Java Collections Framework provides a set of interfaces and classes for storing, organizing, and manipulating collections of objects.
